flashcards.summary: A set of well-defined , step by step instructions to solve a particular problem or perform a computation.
The classification of different types of data.
a named storage location in a computers memory that holds a value.
Symbols () that represent actions or processes to be preformed on operands. ( variables = values)
The order in which a program's instructions are executed, determined by conditional statements and loops.
Code that performs a different action depending on weather a programmer-specified boolean condition is true or false.
A control structure that repeatedly executes a block of code until a certain condition is met.
A block of code that performs a specific task and can be called by name.
The value or expression passed into a function when it is called.
the set of rules that defines the structure of a programming language, similar to grammar in human language.
A word reserved by a programming language that has a special meaning and cannot be used as a variable name.
A collection of source code files that can be executed by a computer to perform a specific task.
Human-readable code written by a programmer.
A program that translates source code written in a high-level language into machine code that a computer can execute.
A program thar executes source code line by line without first compiling it into machine code.
The process of identifying , analyzing and fixing bugs or errors in a computer program.
A set of rules and protocols that allows different software applications to communicate with each other.
A collection of pre-written functions, classes , or modules that developers can use to perform common tasks.
A pre-built structure of code that provides a foundation for building an application.
A system that records changes to a file or set of files overtime, making it easier to track and revert changes.
Software that provides comprehensive tools for software development, such as a code editor, compiler, debugger etc..
